page.title: 15CHANGING TIMES-CONT
page.content: variety.There were two butchers,two bakers,two drapers,a fruit shop,and four grocers .All this trade was generated by the rich people who lived in the large houses on Shore Road.Now many of these were split up into flats and owned by workers from the two Bases.In addition almost everyone had a car and shopped in{Helensburgh}Cove had suffered most and was almost a ghost village.Public Transport is not so good now.The last boat was 9-30pm now it is 6-20pm.The last bus was 11-45pm now it is 8-00pm.The car is responsible for this too. The change which seemed to bother people most was the moving population. This had been an area where people were very settled and the few newcomers were absorbed into the community now they vastly outnumber the indigenous population.
